descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of solving linear equations.
Student can solve simple linear equations with integer coefficients but struggles with multi-step equations.
Student can solve most linear equations with integer coefficients, including multi-step equations, but makes occasional errors.
Student can solve linear equations with integer coefficients accurately and efficiently.
Student can solve linear equations with rational coefficients and can manipulate equations with variables on both sides.
Student can solve complex linear equations with coefficients represented by letters, demonstrating a strong understanding of algebraic manipulation.
Student demonstrates no understanding of solving linear inequalities.
Student can solve simple linear inequalities but struggles with understanding the direction of the inequality sign.
Student can solve most linear inequalities but makes errors when multiplying or dividing by a negative number.
Student can solve linear inequalities accurately, including those requiring multiplication or division by a negative number.
Student can represent the solution set of linear inequalities on a number line and can solve compound inequalities.
Student can solve and graph the solution sets of complex linear inequalities, including those with absolute value.
Student demonstrates no understanding of solving literal equations.
Student can identify the variable to be solved for in a literal equation but struggles with isolating it.
Student can solve simple literal equations for a specified variable but makes errors with more complex equations.
Student can solve literal equations for a specified variable accurately, showing a good understanding of algebraic manipulation.
Student can solve literal equations with multiple variables and can rearrange formulas to solve for different variables.
Student can solve complex literal equations and can apply them to real-world problems, demonstrating a deep understanding of their structure.
